intro: Charia chevalieri, commonly known as the dwarf velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are covered in a fine, velvety hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils in its native habitat.
